definition: to make out/to see
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: But He perceived their craftiness and said to them.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣看出他们的诡诈，就对他们说。

sentences.english: The red packaging and the plastic lid can be seen in the picture.
sentences.chinese: 图片可以看出，在红色的包装和塑料盖。

sentences.english: After seeing how vulnerable these scripts are to hackings and holes.
sentences.chinese: 在看出这些脚本对黑客和漏洞是多么脆弱之后。

sentences.english: You can probably see the obvious advantages to structuring your information this way.
sentences.chinese: 您大概可以看出用该方法构造信息结构的明显优势。

sentences.english: The bird is small to winter jasmine, enough to see that they love for spring.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿很小就来迎春，足以看出它们对春的喜爱。

sentences.english: He turned, his eyes huge and bright even in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 他转过身来，在昏暗中也能看出他的眼睛又大又亮。

sentences.english: As can be seen from the cartoon, nowadays many people follow the hen and swarm into the tide of promise-making.
sentences.chinese: 从图中看出，现如今很多人跟随潮流，信奉承诺制。

sentences.english: And that you can see with your naked eye.
But everyone can tell cheap or poorly cared-for shoes.
sentences.chinese: 但是每个人都能看出廉价或者不常打理的鞋子来。

sentences.english: From them we can see obviously what the compiler is emphasizing.
sentences.chinese: 从中明显可以看出诉述主体的失重态势。
你应该看出了这里的暗示。

sentences.english: What can we tell from these pillars?
sentences.chinese: 那从几根柱子能看出什么呢？

sentences.english: She never let Michael see how hard this was on her.
sentences.chinese: 她从不让迈克尔看出这对她来说是多么难以承受。

sentences.english: Gross crystalline imperfections like twinning are apparent to the unaided eye .
sentences.chinese: 粗的晶体不完整性，如孪生体可用肉眼看出。

sentences.english: And I saw that wisdom excels folly as light excels darkness.
sentences.chinese: 我便看出智慧胜过愚昧，如同光明胜过黑暗。

sentences.english: As can be seen from the picture, the back ground is the Muda Dam.
sentences.chinese: 可以看出，从图片，回到地面是慕达水坝。

definition: boundary/clue/indication/to obtain clues/to infer
can't see/can't make out/unable to tell
to come and see/to see a topic from a certain point of view
lit. to glimpse just one spot (of the panther) (idiom)/fig. to get an inkling of the whole picture
to conclude/to determine/to come to a judgment
to obtain (results)/to arrive at (a conclusion)
it can clearly be seen (that this is the case)/it is (thus) clear/clear/visible
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
pleasant to the eye/Taiwan pr. [zhong4 kan4]
to distinguish/to differentiate/to resolve
lateral side/side/aspect/profile
to express/to exhibit
to embody/to reflect/to incarnate
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
to explain/to illustrate/to indicate/to show/to prove/explanation/directions/caption/CL:個|个[ge4]
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
